subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Hi, folks
msgSnippet: On 8/9/2002 at 3:16 PM andy_callaway wrote: H lo, Andy... ... I ll throw a wrench in here.. ;) Most spelling reform schemes- particularly Shavian and
messageBody:
On 8/9/2002 at 3:16 PM andy_callaway wrote:

H'lo, Andy...

>I've just joined this group. I've been interested in spelling reform
>for a number of years now, and have been looking around at the
>different alternatives. A couple of years ago, I got interested in
>Shavian, and some time after that Quikscript.

I'll throw a wrench in here.. ;) Most spelling reform schemes- particularly Shavian and Quikscript- really only work effectively with a particular accent, as they're not flexible enough to deal with unifying dialectual/accentual permutations (which are _usually_ consistant)- That is, under current Shavian and Quikscript schemes, no two accents will spell the same. (Not to mention that neither seem to accomodate borrowed phonetics used in English!)

>Some of you may know my name. I see a couple of familiar names in
>here, possible from alt.language.english.spelling.reform. I was the
>one who created the Shaw Script font, and the Rosetta phonetic
>translator.

Andy, you know me from the Shavian group here at Yahoo!...

D.M.Falk
